definition: dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated

sentences.english: Poor maintenance of public facilities can have disastrous health implications.
sentences.chinese: 公共设施失修可造成卫生灾难。

sentences.english: The building had been dilapidated by neglect.
sentences.chinese: 这座大楼因失修而圮毁。

sentences.english: The dilapidated barn detracts charm from the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 圮废失修的谷仓有损景色的美。

sentences.english: After the two temples are in disrepair Qingta, re-built in 1981.
sentences.chinese: 后两庙皆失修倾塌，1981年重新修建。

sentences.english: The roof of that ancient temple caved in because of bad maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 由于年久失修那个古庙的屋顶塌了。

sentences.english: Mr Obama is right that America's infrastructure is creaking (see article).
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马正确地指出了美国的基础设施年久失修。

sentences.english: The group found that dams are, on average, in terrible disrepair.
sentences.chinese: 该协会称，水坝基本处于严重失修状态。

sentences.english: The justs Road bridge is currently in need of repair work.
sentences.chinese: 桥的失修就会导致渠道的冲切。

definition: old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to abandon/to let go to waste
to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
see 殘垣斷壁|残垣断壁[can2 yuan2 duan4 bi4]
